src:
Prenova bazena in gradnja stadiona
05 Nov 2019, 18:00 by L. M.
Sevnica - Sevniška občina se je zaradi zakasnitve projektov, podprtih z denarjem dogovora za razvoj regij, letos lotila le več manjših naložb. Med največjimi sta 1,2-milijonska prenova kopališkega bazena in gradnja sevniškega stadiona, ki je občino do zdaj stala približno 800.000 evrov. Večje naložbe si Sevničani obetajo v prihodnjih dveh letih.
Sevniški župan Srečko Ocvirk je na današnji novinarski konferenci ob skorajšnjem občinskem prazniku glede prenove krajevnega bazena povedal, da so se po spomladi končani prenovi bazenske školjke in napeljave ob bazenu jeseni oz. po koncu kopališke sezone lotili še drugega dela naložbe. Gre za prenovo strojnice in filtrske postaje, pri čemer bodo vgradili plinsko peč in zalogovnik za pripravo sanitarne vode. Načrtujejo še izdelavo deklorinacijskega bazena za čiščenje vode pred izpustom v kanalizacijo, v končnem delu gradbenih posodobitev pa še montažo strojnih in električnih napeljav. Prenovo nameravajo končati januarja prihodnje leto, je napovedal župan.
V nadaljevanju se je dotaknil gradnje sevniškega stadiona, katerega pripravljalna dela so stekla aprila lani, gradnjo pa je nato zavrla neugodna geološka podlaga.
Ocvirk je pojasnil, da bodo morali zaradi "nepredvidenega odziva terena na lani izvedeno stabilizacijo z globokimi drenažami izvesti še dodatno stabilizacijo območja" in da občina pospešeno išče rešitve, s katerimi bi zagotovila nemoten potek nadaljnje gradnje tega športnega objekta v prihodnjih letih. Rešitve pričakujejo prihodnje leto, je dodal. Opozoril je še na več letošnjih manjših naložb v prometno in komunalno infrastrukturo ter protipoplavno varnost. Vlagali so tudi v prostorsko načrtovanje, javne objekte, družbene dejavnosti in podobno. Sevniška občina je občinskemu gospodarstvu in kmetijstvu letos namenila skupaj 160 tisoč evrov spodbude.

V prihodnjih dveh letih za 7 milijonov evrov naložb

Kot je povzel, si na Sevniškem večje naložbe v skupni vrednosti približno sedem milijonov evrov obetajo v prihodnjih dveh letih. Gre za izvedbo "treh pomembnih projektov", in sicer za povezavo javnih vodovodnih sistemom na obeh savskih bregovih z več kot 10 tisoč uporabniki.
V sklopu drugega projekta nameravajo stopnjo priključenosti na komunalni sistem in čistilno napravo v Sevnici dvigniti na 98 odstotkov, v okviru tretjega projekta pa urediti območje zunajnivojskega križanja enotirne železniške proge Trebnje-Sevnica s ciljem ureditve poslovne cone v Šmarju.
Pri vseh treh naložbah si po dogovoru za razvoj regij obetajo od 80- do 85-odstotno denarno podporo, je še dejal Ocvirk. V drugem delu novinarske konference je direktor Kmečke zadruge Sevnica Borut Florjančič spomnil na stoletnico zadružništva na Sevniškem.
text:
Pool renovation and stadium construction
05 Nov 2019, 17:00 by L.M.
Sevnica - Due to the delay of projects backed by the money of the agreement for the development of the regions, the municipality of Sevnica has only undertaken several small investments this year. One of the largest is the $ 1.2 million renovation of the swimming pool and the construction of the Sevnica stadium, which has cost the municipality about 800,000 euros so far. More investments are expected by the citizens of Sevnica in the next two years.
Sevnica Mayor Srecko Ocvirk said at a press conference on the occasion of the upcoming municipal holiday regarding the renovation of the local swimming pool that the renovation of the swimming pool shells and the installation of the swimming pools in the autumn or autumn were completed. after the end of the bathing season, they started another part of the investment. It is a refurbishment of an engine room and a filter station, with a gas furnace and a storage tank for the preparation of hot water. They also plan to build a declorination pool for water treatment before it is released into the sewage system, and in the final part of the construction updates they will also install mechanical and electrical installations. They plan to finish the renovation in January next year, the mayor announced.
He then touched on the construction of the Sevnica stadium, whose preparatory work began in April last year, and was subsequently rejected by an unfavorable geological base.
Ocvirk explained that due to the "unforeseen response of the terrain to last year, deep drainage stabilization will have to further stabilize the area" and that the municipality is rapidly seeking solutions to ensure the smooth course of further construction of this sports facility in the coming years. The solutions are expected next year, he added. He also pointed to several smaller investments in transport and communal infrastructure and flood protection this year. They also invested in spatial planning, public facilities, social activities and the like. The municipality of Sevnica allocated a total of EUR 160,000 to the municipal economy and agriculture this year.

Over the next two years, there will be an investment of EUR 7 million

He added that in Sevnica, major investments worth around seven million euros are expected in the next two years. It is about the implementation of "three important projects", namely the connection of public water supply systems on both Sava banks with more than 10 thousand users.
As part of the second project, the level of connection to the municipal system and sewage treatment plant in Sevnica is planned to be raised to 98 percent, and within the third project the area of off-level intersection of the one-line Trebnje-Sevnica railway line should be arranged with the aim of establishing a business zone in Šmarje.
According to the agreement for the development of the regions, all three investments are expected to receive 80- to 85% financial support, Ocvirk said. In the second part of the press conference, the director of the Sevnica Peasant Cooperative Borut Florjančič recalled the centenary of the cooperative in Sevnica.
